Quote: If you're referring to the incident with the dragon, I was barely involved. All I did was give your Uncle a little nudge out the door.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Whatever you did, you've been officially labelled as a disturber of the peace.
Speaker: Frodo

Quote: No, thank you! We don't want any more visitors, well wishers, or distant relations.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: It's good to see you. One hundred and eleven years old, who would believe it? You haven't aged a day!
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Tea? Or maybe something stronger... I've a few bottles of the Old Winyard left, 1296...a very good year, almost as old as I am.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: I've got to get away from these confounded relatives, hanging on the bell all day, never giving me a moment's peace. I want to see mountains again...mountains, Gandalf!
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: he's a Baggins...not some block headed Bracegirdle from Hardbottle!
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: He'd probably come with me if I asked him. I think, in his heart, Frodo's still in love with the Shire, the woods and the fields... little rivers.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: I feel thin...sort of stretched, like butter scraped over too much bread. I need a holiday...a very long holiday and I don't expect I shall return...in fact, I mean not to.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: Gandalf my old friend...this will be a night to remember!
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you as well as well as you deserve.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: I regret to announce, this is the end. I am going now. I bid you all a very fond farewell!
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: There are many magic rings in the world, Bilbo Baggins, and none of them should be used lightly.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Yes, yes, it's in an envelope... over there on the mantelpiece. No, wait. It's here in my pocket. Isn't that... isn't' that odd now? Yet, after all, why not? Why shouldn't I keep it?
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: I think you should leave the Ring behind, Bilbo. Is that so hard?
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Bilbo Baggins! Do not take me for some conjurer of cheap tricks! I am not trying to rob you. I am trying to help you.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Keep it secret, keep it safe.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: In the common tongue it says, "One ring to rule them all, One ring to find them, One ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them."
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: I ain't been dropping no eaves, sir! Honest. I was just cutting the grass under the window there, if you follow me.
Speaker: Sam

Quote: I don't know why he's so upset, it's only a couple of carrots. // And some cabbages...and those three bags of potatoes that we lifted last week. And then the mushrooms the week before.
Speaker: Merry & Pippin

Quote: Right... Buckleberry Ferry, follow me!
Speaker: Merry

Quote: How far to the nearest crossing? // Brandywine bridge... twenty miles.
Speaker: Frodo & Merry

Quote: Hobbits! Four Hobbits, and what's more, out of the Shire by your talk. What business brings you to Bree?
Speaker: Gatekeeper at Bree

Quote: All right, young sir, I meant no offense. It's my job to ask questions after nightfall. There's talk of strange fold abroad... can't be too careful.
Speaker: Gatekeeper at Bree

Quote: Oh yes! I remember... elderly chap, big grey beard, pointy hat? Not seen him for six months.
Speaker: Butterbur

Quote: It comes in pints? I'm getting one!
Speaker: Pippin

Quote: He's one of them Rangers; they're dangerous folk they are, wandering the wilds. What his right name is, I never heard, but round here he's known as Strider.
Speaker: Butterbur

Quote: Baggins? Sure, I know a Baggins; he's over there. Frodo Baggins. He's my second cousin once removed, on his mother's side and my third cousin twice removed on his father's side... if you follow me.
Speaker: Pippin

Quote: Are you frightened? // Yes // Not nearly frightened enough. I know what hunts you.
Speaker: Aragorn & Frodo

Quote: What about breakfast? // You've already had it. // We've had one, yes. But what about Second Breakfast? // I don't think he knows about second breakfast, Pip. // What about Elvenses, Luncheon, Afternoon Tea, dinner... he knows about them, doesn't he? // I wouldn't count on it.
Speaker: Aragorn, Pippin & Merry

Quote: What are you doing? // Tomatoes, sausages, and crispy bacon. // We saved some for you, Mr. Frodo. // Put it out, you fools! Put it out!
Speaker: Frodo, Pippin & Sam

Quote: Oh, that's nice...ash on my tomatoes!
Speaker: Pippin

Quote: What is this? A Ranger caught off his guard?
Speaker: Arwen

Quote: There are five Wraiths behind you, where the other four are, I do not know.
Speaker: Arwen

Quote: If you want him, come and claim him.
Speaker: Arwen

Quote: You are in the House of Elrond, and it is ten o'clock in the morning on October the twenty-fourth, if you want to know.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Yes, I'm here and you're lucky to be here, too. A few more hours and you would have been beyond our aid. You have some strength in you, my dear Hobbit.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: There is only one Lord of the Ring. Only one who can bend it to his will, and he does not share power.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Our list of allies grows thin.
Speaker: Elrond

Quote: His treachery runs deeper than you know.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: The time of the Elves is over. My people are leaving these shores. Who will you look to when we have gone? The dwarves? They hide in their mountains seeking riches. They care nothing for the troubles of others.
Speaker: Elrond

Quote: I was there the day the strength of Men failed.
Speaker: Elrond

Quote: Cast it into the fire...destroy it!
Speaker: Elrond

Quote: I would rather share one lifetime with you than face all the ages of this world alone.
Speaker: Arwen

Quote: It is a gift... a gift to the foes of Mordor!
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: You cannot wield it. None of us can. The one ring answers to Sauron alone... it has no other master.
Speaker: Aragorn

Quote: This is no mere Ranger. He is Aragorn, son of Arathorn. You owe him your allegiance.
Speaker: Legolas

Quote: The ring cannot be destroyed, Gimli, son of Gloin, by any craft that we here possess. The ring was made in the fires of Mount Doom. Only there can it be un-made.
Speaker: Elrond

Quote: One does not simply walk into Mordor. Its black gates are guarded by more than just Orcs. There is evil there that does not sleep and the Great Eye is ever watchful. It is a barren wasteland, riddled with fire and ash and dust. The very air you breathe is a poisonous fume. Not with ten thousand men could you do this. It is folly.
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: I will be dead before I see the Ring in the hands of an Elf!
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: I will help you bear this burden, Frodo Baggins, as long as it is yours to bear.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: If, by my life or death, I can protect you, I will.
Speaker: Aragorn

Quote: And my axe.
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: No, Indeed, it is hardly possible to separate you... even when he is summoned to a secret council and you are not.
Speaker: Elrond

Quote: You need people of intelligence on this sort of mission... quest... thing.
Speaker: Pippin

Quote: Yes, yes, made by the Elves, you know. The blade glows blue when Orcs are close... and it's times like that, my lad, when you have to be extra careful.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: Here's a pretty thing. Mithril, as light as a feather, and as hard as dragon scales.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: Oh! My old Ring... I should very much like to hold it again, one last time.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: I'm sorry, that I brought this upon you, my boy... I'm sorry that you must carry this burden. I'm sorry for everything.
Speaker: Bilbo

Quote: If anyone were to ask for my opinion, which I note they have not, I would say we are taking the long way round. Gandalf, we can pass through the Mines of Moria. My cousin, Balin, would give us a royal welcome.
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: What is that? // Nothing...it's just a wisp of a cloud.
Speaker: Sam & Gimli

Quote: It is a strange fate that we should suffer so much fear and doubt over so small a thing... such a little thing.
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: There is a fell voice in the air.
Speaker: Legolas

Quote: Let the ringbearer decide.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: It reads, "The door of Durin, Lord of Moria. Speak, friend, and enter."
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Speak, friend, and enter. What's the Elvish for friend? // Oh... mellon.
Speaker: Frodo & Gandalf

Quote: So, master elf, you will enjoy the fabled hospitality of the dwarves; roaring fires, malt beer, red meat off the bone. This, my friend, is the home of my cousin, Balin, and they call this a mine... a mine!
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: This is no mine... it's a tomb!
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: We now have but one choice. We must face the long dark of Moria. Be on your guard... there are older and fouler things than the Orcs in the deep places of the world.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: I have no memory of this place.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Many that live deserve death, and some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them, Frodo?
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Do not be too eager to deal out death in judgment...even the very wise cannot see all ends.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: I wish the ring had never come to me... I wish none of this had happened.
Speaker: Frodo

Quote: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: If in doubt, Meriadoc, always follow your nose!
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Fool of a Took! Throw yourself in next time and rid us of your stupidity!
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: They have a cave troll!
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: You should be dead. That spear would've skewered a wild boar!
Speaker: Aragorn

Quote: I think there's more to this hobbit than meets the eye.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Nobody tosses a dwarf!
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: You shall not pass!
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: I am a servant of the Secret Fire, wielder of the flame of Anor. The dark fire will not avail you, flame of Udun.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Fly, you fools!
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Give them a moment... for pity's sake!
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: Well, here's one dwarf she won't ensnare so easily. I have the eyes of a hawk and the ears of a fox!
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: The dwarf breathes so loud we could have shot him in the dark.
Speaker: Haldir

Quote: Even the wisest cannot tell for the mirror shows many things... things that were... things that are... and some things that have not yet come to pass.
Speaker: Galadriel

Quote: I know what it is you saw... for it is also in my mind. It is the future, Frodo. It is what will come to pass if you should fail.
Speaker: Galadriel

Quote: They were Elves once. Taken by the Dark Powers, tortured and mutilated, a ruined and terrible form of life. And now... perfected.
Speaker: Saruman

Quote: Hunt them down. Do not stop until they are found. You do not know pain. You do not know fear. You will taste man-flesh.
Speaker: Saruman

Quote: Oh, yes, just a simple matter of finding our way through Emyn Muil, an impassable labyrinth of razor sharp rocks. And after that gets even better... a festering, stinking marshland, far as the eye can see.
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: I know why you seek solitude. You suffer, I see it day by day. Are you sure you do not suffer needlessly?
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: I know what you would say, and it would seem like wisdom but for the warning of my heart.
Speaker: Frodo

Quote: Why do you recoil? I am no thief. // You are not yourself.
Speaker: Boromir & Frodo

Quote: I swore to protect you. // Can you protect me from yourself?
Speaker: Aragorn & Frodo

Quote: I would have gone with you to the end... into the very fires of Mordor.
Speaker: Aragorn

Quote: I would have followed you, my brother, my captain, my King.
Speaker: Boromir

Quote: I'm going to Mordor alone. // Of course you are, and I'm coming with you!
Speaker: Frodo & Sam

Quote: We travel light. Let's hunt some Orc.
Speaker: Aragorn

Quote: The Road goes ever on and on, down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, and I must follow, if I can, pursuing it with eager feet, until it joins some larger way where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: That there’s some good in this world, Mr. Frodo. And it’s worth fighting for.
Speaker: Samwise

Quote: How could the world go back to the way it was when so much bad happened? But in the end, it’s only a passing thing, this shadow. Even darkness must pass. A new day will come.
Speaker: Samwise

Quote: All that is gold does not glitter, not all those who wander are lost; the old that is strong does not wither, deep roots are not reached by the frost. from the ashes a fire shall be woken, a light from the shadows shall spring; renewed shall be blade that was broken, the crownless again shall be king.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Not all who wander are lost.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Faithless is he who says farewell when the road darkens.
Speaker: Gimli

Quote: May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.
Speaker: Galadriel

Quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: Short cuts make long delays.
Speaker: Gandalf

Quote: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.
Speaker: Gandalf
